availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George F. Cunningham (1st Lieut., 8th KY Cav.)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Resident of Lincoln County in 1850. Mustered into service as a first lieutenant in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment on September 8, 1862, in Russelville, Kentucky. Mustered out of service on September 17, 1863, in Lebanon, Kentucky. Killed by alleged guerrillas in Hustonville, Lincoln County, in January 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Hustonville, p. 119.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 222. (Listed as John F. Cunningham)
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 088.
KYR-0002-022-0084.
